vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.8.16;
son of: Ahilud (H0286);
brother of: Baana (H1195)
§ Jehoshaphat = "Jehovah has judged"
n pr m
1) son of king Asa and himself king of Judah for 25 years; one of the best, most pious, and prosperous kings of Judah
2) son of Nimshi and father of king Jehu of the northern kingdom of Israel
3) son of Ahilud and chronicler under David and Solomon
4) son of Paruah and one of the 12 commissary officers under Solomon
5) a priest and trumpeter in the time of David
n pr loc
6) symbolical name of a valley near Jerusalem which is the place of ultimate judgment; maybe the deep ravine which separates Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives through which the Kidron flowed
vocabinfos._es_Definition: (a)   hijo de Ahilud; archivista; en tiempos del rey David; (b)   hijo de Parúah; funcionario; en tiempos del rey Salomón; (c)   hijo de Asá; rey de Judá (870/69-848); (d)   padre de Jehú, rey de Israel; (e)   valle de Josafat; = Valle del Cedrón, al este de Jerusalén
vocabinfos._zh_tw_Definition:
約沙法 这个字在希伯來文的意思是 "耶和華已審判"
陽性專有名詞
1) 猶大王亞撒的兒子, 在位二十五年; 猶大國最好, 最虔敬, 最成功的一位王
2) 寧示的兒子, 北國以色列王耶戶的父親; #王下 9:14|
3) 亞希律的兒子, 在大衛與所羅門王下當史官; #撒下 8:16|
4) 帕路亞的兒子, 所羅門在以色列全地立的十二個官吏之一; #王上 4:17|
5) 大衛王朝負責吹角的一名祭司; #代上 15:24|
陽性專有名詞, 地名
6) 谷名, 近耶路撒冷,象徵神最後審判的地方; 分開耶路撒冷與的橄欖山的深谷,汲淪溪
流經之地
vocabinfos._zh_Definition:
约沙法 这个字在希伯来文的意思是 "耶和华已审判"
阳性专有名词
1) 犹大王亚撒的儿子, 在位二十五年; 犹大国最好, 最虔敬, 最成功的一位王
2) 宁示的儿子, 北国以色列王耶户的父亲; #王下 9:14|
3) 亚希律的儿子, 在大卫与所罗门王下当史官; #撒下 8:16|
4) 帕路亚的儿子, 所罗门在以色列全地立的十二个官吏之一; #王上 4:17|
5) 大卫王朝负责吹角的一名祭司; #代上 15:24|
阳性专有名词, 地名
6) 谷名, 近耶路撒冷,象征神最后审判的地方; 分开耶路撒冷与的橄榄山的深谷,汲沦溪
流经之地

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.17;
son of: Paruah (H6515)
§ Jehoshaphat = "Jehovah has judged"
n pr m
1) son of king Asa and himself king of Judah for 25 years; one of the best, most pious, and prosperous kings of Judah
2) son of Nimshi and father of king Jehu of the northern kingdom of Israel
3) son of Ahilud and chronicler under David and Solomon
4) son of Paruah and one of the 12 commissary officers under Solomon
5) a priest and trumpeter in the time of David
n pr loc
6) symbolical name of a valley near Jerusalem which is the place of ultimate judgment; maybe the deep ravine which separates Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives through which the Kidron flowed

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A king of the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.15.24;
son of: Asa (H0609) and Azubah (H5806);
father of: Jehoram (H3088), Azariah (H5838Q), Jehiel (H3171J), Zechariah (H2148J), Azariahu (H5838R), Michael (H4317O) and Shephatiah (H8203K)
Also named: Iōsaphat<\i> (Ἰωσαφάτ "Jehoshaphat" G2498)
§ Jehoshaphat = "Jehovah has judged"
n pr m
1) son of king Asa and himself king of Judah for 25 years; one of the best, most pious, and prosperous kings of Judah
2) son of Nimshi and father of king Jehu of the northern kingdom of Israel
3) son of Ahilud and chronicler under David and Solomon
4) son of Paruah and one of the 12 commissary officers under Solomon
5) a priest and trumpeter in the time of David
n pr loc
6) symbolical name of a valley near Jerusalem which is the place of ultimate judgment; maybe the deep ravine which separates Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives through which the Kidron flowed

3) son of Ahilud and chronicler under David and Solomon

n pr loc

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
Combined with qid.ron (קִדְרוֹן "Kidron" H6939)
§ Jehoshaphat = "Jehovah has judged"
n pr m
This name is used for:
1) son of king Asa and himself king of Judah for 25 years; one of the best, most pious, and prosperous kings of Judah
2) son of Nimshi and father of king Jehu of the northern kingdom of Israel
3) son of Ahilud and chronicler under David and Solomon
4) son of Paruah and one of the 12 commissary officers under Solomon
5) a priest and trumpeter in the time of David
n pr loc
6) symbolical name of a valley near Jerusalem which is the place of ultimate judgment; maybe the deep ravine which separates Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives through which the Kidron flowed
